greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table of (x+y)/gcd(x,y) where (x,y) runs through the pairs (1,1), (1,2), (2,1), (1,3), (2,2), (3,1), ...
comment: Can also be viewed as a triangular table T(n,k) (n>=1, 1<=k<=n) read by rows: T(1,1); T(2,1), T(2,2); T(3,1), T(3,2), T(3,3); T(4,1), T(4,2), T(4,3), T(4,4); ... where T(n,k) gives the least value v>0 such that v*k = 0 modulo n+1, i.e., in other words, T(n,k) = (n+1)/gcd(n+1,k).
formula: T(n, k) = numerator((n+k)/n) = numerator((n+k)/k). - _Michel Marcus_, Dec 29 2013
example: The top left corner of the square array is:
xref: GF(2)[X] analog: A106449. Row 1 is n+1, row 2 is LEFT(LEFT(LEFT(A026741))), row 3 is LEFT^4(A051176). Essentially the same as A054531, but without its right-hand edge of all-1's.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 21 2005
